Neuroscience.structures.Flip_FLop_T¶

class Neuroscience.structures.Flip_FLop_T.Flip_Flop_T(res)[source]¶

Bases: Neuroscience.structures.Organ.Organ

A class representing a T-type flip-flop circuit constructed using NAND gates.

The Flip_Flop_T class simulates the behavior of a T-type flip-flop using four NAND gates, with each NAND gate composed of excitatory and inhibitory neurons. This class includes methods for passing inputs, printing the state of the neurons, and connecting the flip-flop circuit.

name¶

The name of the flip-flop circuit, initialized as “Flip_Flop”.

Type

str

fst_NAND¶

The first NAND gate in the flip-flop circuit.

Type

Gate_NAND

scd_NAND¶

The second NAND gate in the flip-flop circuit.

Type

Gate_NAND

thrd_NAND¶

The third NAND gate in the flip-flop circuit.

Type

Gate_NAND

fth_NAND¶

The fourth NAND gate in the flip-flop circuit.

Type

Gate_NAND

output_neurons¶

A list containing the output neurons of the flip-flop circuit.

Type

list of Abstract_Neuron

pass_inputs(inputs, k)[source]¶

Passes the inputs to both oscillators and self inputs in the NAND gates.

Parameters

  • inputs (list of float) – A list of inputs to be passed to the NAND gates.

  • k (int) – The index of the current input set.

pass_inputs_oscillators(inputs, k)[source]¶

Sets the inputs for the oscillators in each NAND gate.

Parameters

  • inputs (list of float) – A list of inputs to be passed to the oscillators.

  • k (int) – The index of the current input set.

pass_inputs_selfputs(inputs, k)[source]¶

Sets the self inputs for the first and second NAND gates.

Parameters

  • inputs (list of float) – A list of inputs to be passed to the NAND gates.

  • k (int) – The index of the current input set.

print()[source]¶

Prints the details of all neurons in the flip-flop circuit.
